content.description: Fun short traversing crack, starting as a wide horizontal, moving through a shallow water groove and then a slab top-out. Walk-off descent.
content.protection: Small standard rack. Takes surprisingly good hand-size placements through crux. Gear anchor.
content.location: West side of the ridge forming the crag. Uphill about 50 feet from Dark Horse.

content.description: Very fun and unusual cave crack, mostly hands to a wide crux and exiting out of the cave onto a slab. Must use headlamps for first half of climb before reaching daylight. Beware some loose rock at start. Walk-off descent.
content.protection: Standard rack to #4 cam. Gear anchor.
content.location: Large cleft in boulder at bottom of crag on the backside of the overhung face of Charlatan. Descend to bottom of the cleft.

content.description: Physical, in your face, and stays with you longer than it should. An awesome little route. Overhanging finger-crack trends left and eventually widens as it crosses above a dark streak. Walk-off descent climber's left.Note: the original tongue-in-cheek name of this route hadn’t aged well. In consultation with the FA party, it has been renamed. Go climb it!
content.protection: 1 bolt at start (stick-clip). Standard rack to #3. Gear anchor.
content.location: Downhill end of rocky ridge below Byrds Nest shelter, north/northwest facing.

content.description: Fun crack traverse into hand jams, an intermediate slab step, and a challenging overhung crack on a suspended boulder. Walk-off descent.
content.protection: Standard rack. Beware to protect topout for follower. Gear anchor.
content.location: West side of the ridge forming the crag. 15 feet right of Dark Horse.

content.description: Fun hand-crack system leads to a blank face with crimpy crux and slabby top-out.
content.protection: Standard rack. 1 bolt (long clip) protects the direct finish up the face. Move left instead of clipping the bolt to finish on quite runout 5.10-.
content.location: At lower climber's right end of crag, 30 feet right of Charlatan. Walk-off descent to climber's right.

content.description: Hidden crag with excellent variety of routes
